hook.text: Some companies screenshot your laptop every 10 minutes while you work from home. Smile â€” you're on camera.

buildup.text: Monitoring software can track keystrokes, mouse movement, websites visited, emails, and even webcam feeds.

discovery.text: Use of surveillance software jumped 65% during COVID remote work. Bosses couldn't see desks, so they watched screens.

twist.text: Studies show monitored employees report higher stress and lower creativity, but managers just feel more in control.

climax.text: The paradox: surveillance meant to boost productivity often destroys the trust that productivity requires.

punchline.text: Watching people work harder doesn't make them work better.

quiz.question: What effect does employee monitoring often have on workers?
options: It increases stress and decreases creativity
It has no measurable impact at all
